group_1.textCenter: Let's see...@Is this all the loose leaf paper we have...?
When you look at everything here, we've covered@a lot of ground, haven't we, Aru?
<But there's more than just interviews@on these papers.>
<There's a lot of other notes you wrote@on your own, Kagome.>
I guess you could say that.

group_1.narration: After a long break,@I wanted to compile my notes.
I don't know what'll happen each day,@so I jotted down all kinds of stuff@on small pieces of loose leaf paper@so that I could piece them together@like a puzzle later on.
Before I knew it,@I found myself with a drawer full of notes.

group_1.textCenter: This was the first time I met Iroha...
This was about the conflict between@the Tokime Clan and Neo-Magius.
And this was when I asked Touka and Nemu@about Magical Girls.

group_1.narration: Since Magical Girls were in conflict with each other,@some of the notes were very graphic.

group_1.textCenter: This story is about a cooking incident that@happened at the Coordinator's shop.
Then this story is about Manaka's cooking class.
And here is a story about the festival@at Mizuna Girls' Academy... Hehe.

group_1.narration: Aside from the fact that they're Magical Girls,@they live the same daily lives as me.
That's why I wanted to depict Magical Girls@just as they are—like regular people.@Hence why I was taking notes@of everyone's daily lives.

group_1.textCenter: <You have notes about Christmas, New Year's—@all sorts of events.>
I've learned a lot, including some stories@that happened before I got here.
The most common story... Yeah, it might be about@"summer vacation."
Today, I'll think I'll try to compile stories@of everyday life, not conflict.

group_1.narration: In front of me are my notes...
...as well as the stories of "summer memories"@that I have from everyone.
I want to read them again@before I think about how to put them together.
All the summer days everyone spent together.
